Use a Laser Drill Beacon on large Letium finds to call down a Drill, then activate and protect it
The drill can carry you home if you remain inside when it takes off

Activities_Contract_Easy-ICA-PowerUp-1.name: Batteries Not Included I
Activities_Contract_Easy-ICA-PowerUp-1.description:
Access the contents of a Secure Facility
You will need to find Heavy Batteries on the surface to power up the facility

Activities_Contract_Medium-ICA-PowerUp-1.name: Batteries Not Included II
Activities_Contract_Medium-ICA-PowerUp-1.description:
Access the contents of a Secure Facility
You will need to find Heavy Batteries on the surface to power up the facility

Activities_Contract_Hard-ICA-PowerUp-1.name: Batteries Not Included III
Activities_Contract_Hard-ICA-PowerUp-1.description:
Access the contents of a Secure Facility
You will need to find Heavy Batteries on the surface to power up the facility

Activities_Contract_Easy-ICA-Uplink-1.name: Big Data I
Activities_Contract_Easy-ICA-Uplink-1.description:
Plug in a Data Drive at an Uplink Station (often located near large satellite dishes)
Empty Data Drives can be purchased if you have none

Activities_Contract_Medium-ICA-Uplink-1.name: Big Data II
Activities_Contract_Medium-ICA-Uplink-1.description:
Plug in a Data Drive at an Uplink Station (often located near large satellite dishes)
Empty Data Drives can be purchased if you have none

Activities_Contract_Hard-ICA-Uplink-1.name: Big Data III
Activities_Contract_Hard-ICA-Uplink-1.description:
Plug in a Data Drive at an Uplink Station (often located near large satellite dishes)
Empty Data Drives can be purchased if you have none

Activities_Contract_Easy-ICA-StormSurge-.name: Power Crystals I
Activities_Contract_Easy-ICA-StormSurge-.description:
Retrieve crystal samples created by Storm Surges
You can locate a Storm Surge by the violent lightning strikes and the red tint of its radiation

Activities_Contract_Medium-ICA-StormSurg.name: Power Crystals II
Activities_Contract_Medium-ICA-StormSurg.description:
Retrieve crystal samples created by Storm Surges
You can locate a Storm Surge by the violent lightning strikes and the red tint of its radiation

Activities_Contract_Hard-ICA-StormSurge-.name: Power Crystals III
Activities_Contract_Hard-ICA-StormSurge-.description:
Retrieve crystal samples created by Storm Surges
You can locate a Storm Surge by the violent lightning strikes and the red tint of its radiation

Activities_Contract_Medium-Osiris-Tracki.name: Live Sample
Activities_Contract_Medium-Osiris-Tracki.description:
Bring back a Blue Runner Egg
Find Blue Runner tracks and follow them to their nest to steal an egg

Activities_Contract_Hard-Osiris-Minerals.name: Mineral Samples
Activities_Contract_Hard-Osiris-Minerals.description:
Buy and equip a mineral scanner
Scan for minerals on rocky areas or dig sites
Use your pickaxe to mine minerals for a chance to find Cloudy Veltecite

Activities_Contract_Hard-KOR-Uplink-1.name: Proprietary Information
Activities_Contract_Hard-KOR-Uplink-1.description:
Buy and equip a Tier 1 Data Drive
Plug the Data Drive into one of the Uplink stations on Fortuna III to gather valuable data
Repeat until you find epic data

Activities_Contract_Medium-KOR-StormSurg.name: Surge Energy
Activities_Contract_Medium-KOR-StormSurg.description:
On Fortuna III look for red storms
Inside the storm area, collect red storm surge crystals
Be careful, lethal lightning strikes fill the Spike area!

Activities_Contract_Easy-Osiris-Material.name: Bad Optics I
Activities_Contract_Easy-Osiris-Material.description: Bring back Optic Glass, often found in abandoned structures

Activities_Contract_Medium-Osiris-Materi.name: Bad Optics II
Activities_Contract_Medium-Osiris-Materi.description: Bring back Optic Glass, often found in abandoned structures

Activities_Contract_Hard-Osiris-Material.name: Bad Optics III
Activities_Contract_Hard-Osiris-Material.description: Bring back Optic Glass, often found in abandoned structures

Activities_Contract_Easy-KOR-Materials-1.name: Ordnance Disposal I
Activities_Contract_Easy-KOR-Materials-1.description: Bring back Derelict Explosives, often found in abandoned structures

Activities_Contract_Medium-KOR-Materials.name: Ordnance Disposal II
Activities_Contract_Medium-KOR-Materials.description: Bring back Derelict Explosives, often found in abandoned structures

Activities_Contract_Hard-KOR-Materials-1.name: Ordnance Disposal III
Activities_Contract_Hard-KOR-Materials-1.description: Bring back Derelict Explosives, often found in abandoned structures

Activities_Contract_Easy-ICA-Materials-1.name: Made ICA Strong I
Activities_Contract_Easy-ICA-Materials-1.description: Bring back Metallic Alloys, often found in abandoned structures

Activities_Contract_Medium-ICA-Materials.name: Made ICA Strong II
Activities_Contract_Medium-ICA-Materials.description: Bring back Metallic Alloys, often found in abandoned structures

Activities_Contract_Hard-ICA-Materials-1.name: Made ICA Strong III
Activities_Contract_Hard-ICA-Materials-1.description: Bring back Metallic Alloys, often found in abandoned structures

Activities_Contract_Easy-Osiris-Meteor-1.name: Falling Stars I
Activities_Contract_Easy-Osiris-Meteor-1.description: Bring back Meteor Shards, mined from smaller fragments of a Meteor Shower Event

Activities_Contract_Medium-Osiris-Meteor.name: Falling Stars II
Activities_Contract_Medium-Osiris-Meteor.description: Bring back a Meteor Core, mined from the Main Meteor of a Meteor Shower Event

Activities_Contract_Hard-Osiris-Meteor-1.name: Falling Stars III
Activities_Contract_Hard-Osiris-Meteor-1.description: Bring back Meteor Cores, mined from the Main Meteor of Meteor Shower Events

Activities_Contract_Easy-KOR_FTUE-Minera.name: Nickel Run
Activities_Contract_Easy-KOR_FTUE-Minera.short_description: You can equip a Mineral Scanner via your Tool Wheel to help you find Nickel Veins
Activities_Contract_Easy-KOR_FTUE-Minera.description: Drop down to Fortuna, mine Nickel Veins using your Pickaxe and bring us back some Nickel.

Activities_Contract_Easy-Osiris_FTUE-Gat.name: A Simple Delivery
Activities_Contract_Easy-Osiris_FTUE-Gat.description: Drop down to Fortuna, search in and around buildings for some Compound Sheets and deliver them back to Osiris

Activities_Contract_Easy-ICA_FTUE-Hunt-1.name: A simple Hunt
Activities_Contract_Easy-ICA_FTUE-Hunt-1.short_description: Try not to alert too many creatures at once, they can quickly overwhelm you
Activities_Contract_Easy-ICA_FTUE-Hunt-1.description: To prove your worth, drop down to Fortuna, look for a Strider and kill it in the name of the ICA

Medium-KOR-Conditional-1.name: Radio Silence
Medium-KOR-Conditional-1.description: Clear the Comms Tower facility on Brightsands of hostile creature

Medium-KOR-Conditional-2.name: Exit Denied
Medium-KOR-Conditional-2.description: Kill a rival prospector at the Bright Sands East Collection Point

Medium-KOR-Conditional-3.name: Moving Rocks
Medium-KOR-Conditional-3.description: Kill hostile creatures at the Bright Sands Dig Site and retrieve Nickel

Medium-KOR-Conditional-4.name: Spring Cleaning
Medium-KOR-Conditional-4.description: Clear the Bright Sands Vaccine Labs of hostile creatures and retrieve their Spinal Bases

Medium-Osiris-Conditional-1.name: Lab Rats
Medium-Osiris-Conditional-1.description: Clear the Waterfall Lab on Bright Sands of hostile creatures

Medium-Osiris-Conditional-2.name: A House of Learning
Medium-Osiris-Conditional-2.description: Clear the Science Campus on Bright Sands of hostile creatures

Medium-Osiris-Conditional-3.name: Muddied Waters
Medium-Osiris-Conditional-3.description: Kill hostile creatures at the Bright Sands Swamp Camp and retrieve Brightcaps

Medium-Osiris-Conditional-4.name: The Big Blue Tree
Medium-Osiris-Conditional-4.description: Kill hostile creatures at the Crashed Ship on Bright Sands retrieve their Spinal Bases

Medium-ICA-Conditional-1.name: Sending a Message
Medium-ICA-Conditional-1.description: Kill a rival prospector at the Bright Sands Comms Tower

Medium-ICA-Conditional-2.name: Our House
Medium-ICA-Conditional-2.description: Kill two rival prospectors at the Bright Sands Base Camp

Medium-ICA-Conditional-3.name: Salvage Run
Medium-ICA-Conditional-3.description: Kill hostile creatures at the Bright Sands Dig Site and retrieve Compound Sheets

Medium-ICA-Conditional-4.name: Poor Upkeep
Medium-ICA-Conditional-4.description: Kill hostile creatures at the Bright Sands Water Facility and the Power Plant next to Comms Tower

NEW-Easy-KOR-Gather-1.name: Reinforcing the old Mine
NEW-Easy-KOR-Gather-1.description: There you are Prospector. We need you to bring us Compound Sheets so we can reinforce the metal supports of one of our old mines on Fortuna III.

NEW-Easy-KOR-Gather-2.name: Mining Machinery
NEW-Easy-KOR-Gather-2.description: We need Ball Bearings to build new mining machinery. Go get us some!

NEW-Easy-KOR-Gather-3.name: Ship Repairs
NEW-Easy-KOR-Gather-3.description: One of our drop ships was damaged by the Storm. We need Magnetic Field Stabilizers and Polymetallic Prefabricate for the repairs.

NEW-Easy-KOR-Gather-4.name: New Mining Tools
NEW-Easy-KOR-Gather-4.description: We are producing new Mining Tools for new Prospectors and need Hydraulic Pistons and Hardened Metals for it. You know what to do.

NEW-Medium-KOR-Gather-1.name: Explosive Excavation
NEW-Medium-KOR-Gather-1.description: One of our mines collapsed with valuable equipment inside. Bring us Derelict Explosives so we can blast it free!

NEW-Medium-KOR-Gather-2.name: Mining Bot
NEW-Medium-KOR-Gather-2.description: Our engineers have designed an autonomous mining bot. Bring us a Zero Systems CPU and some Ball Bearings for the prototype.

NEW-Medium-KOR-Gather-3.name: None of your Business
NEW-Medium-KOR-Gather-3.short_description: Hunt Blast Ticks and Acid Ticks for Toxic Glands
NEW-Medium-KOR-Gather-3.description: Prospector. We need Toxic Glands. Don't ask questions, just go acquire some and bring them back with maximum discretion.

NEW-Medium-KOR-Gather-4.name: Business Class
NEW-Medium-KOR-Gather-4.description: My personal ship needs some... comfort improvements. Bring me Magnetic Field Stabilizers, Compound Sheets and Polymetallic Prefabricate.

NEW-Medium-KOR-Gather-5.name: Insufficient Processing Power
NEW-Medium-KOR-Gather-5.description: Prospector! The Zero Systems CPU you brought us for the mining bot was not powerful enough. We'll need a Master Unit CPU instead.

NEW-Hard-KOR-Gather-1.name: Excavator Improvements
NEW-Hard-KOR-Gather-1.description: The suspension on our mining excavators need improvements to handle rocky terrain. We need Multitools, Ball Bearings and Hydraulic Pistons.

NEW-Hard-KOR-Gather-2.name: A new type of Alloy
NEW-Hard-KOR-Gather-2.short_description: Hunt Marauders for Hardened Bone Plates
NEW-Hard-KOR-Gather-2.description: Our scientists are confident they can create a new, extremely durable alloy from Hardened Bone Plates and Compound Sheets! Bring us what we need.

NEW-Hard-KOR-Gather-3.name: Automated Security
NEW-Hard-KOR-Gather-3.description: We will have to build new turrets to help protect our mining sites and landing pads. Bring us Zero Systems CPUs and Hardened Metals.

NEW-Hard-KOR-Gather-4.name: Energy Crisis
NEW-Hard-KOR-Gather-4.description: Veltecite supplies are low, but we need energy! Get your hands on one of those fabled ICA Miniature Reactors and deliver it to us. Discreetly.

NEW-Hard-KOR-Gather-5.name: Classified I
NEW-Hard-KOR-Gather-5.description: Prospector! We need Derelict Explosives, Master Unit CPUs and Compound Sheets. Dont ask questions, just go acquire the materials.

NEW-Easy-ICA-Gather-1.name: Cooking Equipment
NEW-Easy-ICA-Gather-1.description: Prospector, we need you to bring us Scrap Metal so we can produce more cooking equipment for the ICA community kitchen.

NEW-Easy-ICA-Gather-2.name: Medical Supplies
NEW-Easy-ICA-Gather-2.description: Our community hospital is running out of gauze to make bandages. Drop down to the surface and bring us some Polymetallic Prefabricate!

NEW-Easy-ICA-Gather-3.name: Patching up the Station Hull
NEW-Easy-ICA-Gather-3.description: Prospector! There is a small fracture in the station's hull. It's not huge, but please go get us the Alloys needed to patch it up.

NEW-Easy-ICA-Gather-4.name: Espionage
NEW-Easy-ICA-Gather-4.short_description: Hunt any Creatures for Spinal Bases
NEW-Easy-ICA-Gather-4.description: There you are, Prospector. Osiris seems to be after those Spinal Bases from Fortuna III creatures. We are not sure why, so bring us a sample.

NEW-Easy-ICA-Gather-5.name: Water Filtration System
NEW-Easy-ICA-Gather-5.description: We need to do some repairs to our water filtration system. Bring us Polymetallic Prefabricate and Compound Sheets.

NEW-Medium-ICA-Gather-1.name: New Beds
NEW-Medium-ICA-Gather-1.description: The ICA community housing project has been expanding fast, and we need Azure Tree Bark and Alloys to build some new beds.

NEW-Medium-ICA-Gather-2.name: Scrapping Station Improvements
NEW-Medium-ICA-Gather-2.description: Prospector, we need to make improvements to our scrapping station. For this, bring us Shard Slicers, a Zero Systems CPU and Hardened Metals.

NEW-Medium-ICA-Gather-3.name: Station Defense
NEW-Medium-ICA-Gather-3.description: The targeting systems of our station defense systems have been damaged by Storm radiation. Bring us Autoloaders and Optic Glass for the repairs.

NEW-Medium-ICA-Gather-4.name: Air Lock Upgrades
NEW-Medium-ICA-Gather-4.description: Our engineers designed a safer airlock system that should reduce fatalities. We need Hardened Metals, Alloys and Polymetallic Prefabricate.

NEW-Medium-ICA-Gather-and-PvE-1.name: Alternative Energies
NEW-Medium-ICA-Gather-and-PvE-1.short_description: Hunt any Creatures and deliver their Spinal Bases
NEW-Medium-ICA-Gather-and-PvE-1.description: Prospector! The Spinal Bases you brought us proved to be quite the source of energy. We need more. Go hunt Creatures and bring us their Spinal Bases.

NEW-Hard-ICA-Gather-1.name: Sabotage
NEW-Hard-ICA-Gather-1.description: Prospector! Those Korolev simpletons are drilling near one of our Uplinks. Bring us Zero Systems CPUs and Derelict Explosives. You know why.

NEW-Hard-ICA-Gather-2.name: Old Currency
NEW-Hard-ICA-Gather-2.description: We have received reports of Old Currency being found on Fortuna. That stuff is pretty valuable. Bring us some!

NEW-Hard-ICA-Gather-3.name: Recoil Compensation
NEW-Hard-ICA-Gather-3.description: Upgrades to our rifles are long overdue. To go into production with improved Recoil Compensators, we need Shock Absorbers and Compound Sheets.

NEW-Hard-ICA-Gather-and-PvE-4.name: Espionage II
NEW-Hard-ICA-Gather-and-PvE-4.short_description: Hunt any Creatures and deliver their Spinal Bases
NEW-Hard-ICA-Gather-and-PvE-4.description: Osiris is gaining an incredible amount of energy from Charged Spinal Bases. Go kill creatures to cut off their supply and get us some samples.

NEW-Hard-ICA-Gather-5.name: New 3D Printer
NEW-Hard-ICA-Gather-5.description: Prospector! To help us provide our troops with the gear and supplies they require, we need Shard Slicers and Autoloaders for a new 3D printer.

NEW-Hard-ICA-Oil-1.name: Striking Big
NEW-Hard-ICA-Oil-1.short_description: Craft some Oil Pump Beacons, search around Crescent Falls for Oil Fields and deploy a Pump on the biggest Oil Fountain you can find for maximum return!
NEW-Hard-ICA-Oil-1.description: Damn it! We ran out of Fuel for our Radiation Shields here on the Station. And there's no replacement for Nanite Infused Crude Oil. You know what to do.

NEW-Easy-Osiris-Gather-1.name: Spinal Bases
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Gather-1.short_description: Hunt any Creatures on Fortuna for Spinal Bases
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Gather-1.description: Prospector, we managed to extract valuable isotopes from the Spinal Bases of creatures on Fortuna III. Bring us more samples!

NEW-Easy-Osiris-Gather-2.name: Lab equipment
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Gather-2.description: Improvements to our lab equipment are long overdue. Go get us Optic Glass for better microscopes!"

NEW-Medium-Osiris-Gather-1.name: Surveillance Center
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Gather-1.description: We want to expand our surveillance operations here on Prospect Station. Bring us Interactive Screens and Magnetic Field Stabilizers.

NEW-Medium-Osiris-Gather-2.name: Gun Manufacturing
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Gather-2.description: Our material scientists found a way to use Copper Wires and Spinal Bases in the manufacturing process of energy rifles. Bring us some!

NEW-Medium-Osiris-Gather-3.name: Research Drone Repairs
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Gather-3.description: One of our research drones got hit by Storm radiation, frying its flight stabilizers. Bring us Gyroscopes and Interactive Screens for the repairs.

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Gather-1.name: Cretins
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Gather-1.short_description: Hunt Blast Ticks and Acid Ticks for Toxic Glands
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Gather-1.description: Don't ask me how, but those Korolev numbskulls managed to extract powerful toxins from Toxic Glands. We need some samples, Prospector!

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Gather-2.name: Sensor Array Repairs
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Gather-2.description: A Marauder damaged one of our sensor arrays. Bring us Interactive Screens, Optic Glass and Polymetallic Prefabricate so we can fix it.

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Gather-3.name: A new Energy Source?
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Gather-3.short_description: Hunt any Creatures during an active Storm for Charged Spinal Bases
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Gather-3.description: We've found a way to gain energy from Charged Spinal Bases from creatures affected by the Storm. We need some... and some Gyroscopes while you're down there.

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Gather-4.name: Data Center Upgrades
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Gather-4.description: Turns out our data center was not powerful enough for the calculations needed for our energy experiment. Bring us Master Unit CPUs!

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Gather-5.name: Keep the Experiment running
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Gather-5.short_description: Hunt any Creatures during an active Storm for Charged Spinal Bases
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Gather-5.description: Good news, Prospector! The experiment seems to be a success! Bring us more Charged Spinal Bases to keep it running!

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Gather-6.name: Safety Measures
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Gather-6.description: Wonderful. The Meteor Core we acquired is powering our Drone Fleet nicely. But we need Gyroscopes and Autoloaders to stabilize the Reactor.

NEW-Hard-Osiris-EliteCrusher-6.name: The Rarest Sample
NEW-Hard-Osiris-EliteCrusher-6.short_description: Craft an Orbital Cannon Beacon, gear up and search Crescent Falls for the Mysterious Cave Entrance to bring down the Elite Crusher
NEW-Hard-Osiris-EliteCrusher-6.description: Prospector. We need you to drop down there, venture into the Elite Crusher's Cave and hunt down the Specimen. Then bring us a Sample. Be careful.

NEW-Easy-KOR-Mine-1.name: Flawed but useful
NEW-Easy-KOR-Mine-1.short_description: Veltecite Veins can often be found around Waterfalls
NEW-Easy-KOR-Mine-1.description: We are running out of Flawed Veltecite, one of our lower-grade energy sources. Bring us some more!

NEW-Easy-KOR-Mine-3.name: Altered Nickel Supplies
NEW-Easy-KOR-Mine-3.short_description: You can use a Mineral Scanner to help you find Nickel Veins
NEW-Easy-KOR-Mine-3.description: Prospector. You have proven more useful than expected. Now go get us some Altered Nickel for our foundries.

NEW-Easy-KOR-Mine-2.name: Brittle Titan Ore
NEW-Easy-KOR-Mine-2.short_description: Titan Ore Veins can often be found in Caves and Mines
NEW-Easy-KOR-Mine-2.description: Ah, there you are! We need Brittle Titan Ore, Prospector. Don't ask questions, just get us some.

NEW-Easy-KOR-Mine-4.name: Cloudy with a Chance of Laser
NEW-Easy-KOR-Mine-4.short_description: Veltecite Veins can often be found around Waterfalls
NEW-Easy-KOR-Mine-4.description: We are once more in need of your skills, Prospector. This time, we need Cloudy Veltecite for the construction of a new Laser Drill.

NEW-Medium-KOR-Mine-1.name: Clear Veltecite
NEW-Medium-KOR-Mine-1.short_description: Veltecite Veins can often be found around Waterfalls
NEW-Medium-KOR-Mine-1.description: The Veltecite you brought us the other day is already spent. We need more energy! Get us some Clear Veltecite this time!

NEW-Medium-KOR-Mine-and-PvE-2.name: Time to Focus
NEW-Medium-KOR-Mine-and-PvE-2.short_description: Crystal Veins can often be found in the Jungle
NEW-Medium-KOR-Mine-and-PvE-2.description: One of our miners searching the Jungle for Focus Crystals was wounded by creatures. Go clear the area, and bring back Focus Crystals they should have.

NEW-Medium-KOR-Mine-3.name: Pure Veltecite
NEW-Medium-KOR-Mine-3.short_description: Veltecite Veins can often be found around Waterfalls
NEW-Medium-KOR-Mine-3.description: The Clear Veltecite was an improvement, we gained much more energy from it, but we need more! See if you can get your hands on some Pure Veltecite.

NEW-Medium-KOR-Mine-4.name: Titans of Industry
NEW-Medium-KOR-Mine-4.short_description: Titan Ore Veins can often be found in Caves and Mines
NEW-Medium-KOR-Mine-4.description: Scouts have found Titan Ore deposits on Fortuna III! Go see if the rumours are true and bring us samples. And some Altered Nickel, while you're at it.

NEW-Medium-KOR-Mine-5.name: Crystal Frenzy
NEW-Medium-KOR-Mine-5.description: We're working on a new type of laser for our latest mining platforms. For the lenses, we will need Clear Veltecite and Focus Crystals. Off you go!

NEW-Hard-KOR-Mine-1.name: Geologist
NEW-Hard-KOR-Mine-1.description: You got time for a job, Prospector? The samples you brought us weren't pure enough. Get us Pure Veltecite and some Pure Focus Crystals this time.

NEW-Hard-KOR-Mine-2.name: Industry Secret
NEW-Hard-KOR-Mine-2.description: Hm. Interesting. The Pure Focus Crystals you brought us worked perfectly for the new lenses. Bring us more! I can already taste Osiris' envy.

NEW-Hard-KOR-Mine-3.name: Veltecite Hearts
NEW-Hard-KOR-Mine-3.short_description: Veltecite Veins can often be found around Waterfalls
NEW-Hard-KOR-Mine-3.description: Bring us some Veltecite Hearts, the highest purity of Veltecite, for us to experiment on.

NEW-Hard-KOR-Mine-4.name: Laser Rifles
NEW-Hard-KOR-Mine-4.short_description: Focus Crystal Veins can often be found in the Jungle
NEW-Hard-KOR-Mine-4.description: We are prototyping a new laser rifle that can penetrate even Crusher skulls. Get us Focus Crystals and Pure Focus Crystals for the lenses.

NEW-Hard-KOR-Mine-5.name: Classified II
NEW-Hard-KOR-Mine-5.short_description: Veltecite Veins can often be found around Waterfalls
NEW-Hard-KOR-Mine-5.description: Ah, Prospector. We need Clear Veltecite and Derelict Explosives for an experiment. I cannot say any more and expect utmost discretion.

NEW-Hard-KOR-Mine-6.name: Unlimited Power?
NEW-Hard-KOR-Mine-6.short_description: Veltecite Veins can often be found around Waterfalls
NEW-Hard-KOR-Mine-6.description: Fine. I guess you need to know. We are trying to charge Veltecite with power, the same way the Storm does. Bring us more Veltecite Samples.

NEW-Hard-ICA-Mine-1.name: Arms Race
NEW-Hard-ICA-Mine-1.short_description: Focus Crystal Veins can often be found in the Jungle
NEW-Hard-ICA-Mine-1.description: Prospector. It seems like Korolev is working on some sort of new laser rifle that uses Pure Focus Crystals. Go get us some, and be discrete about it.

NEW-Hard-ICA-Mine-2.name: Energy Crisis
NEW-Hard-ICA-Mine-2.short_description: Meteor showers are a random event. Make sure to get there first to mine them!
NEW-Hard-ICA-Mine-2.description: Gear up and go get us some Meteor Fragments and Clear Veltecite! If the rumors are true, this stuff could power our station systems for weeks!

NEW-Easy-KOR-Hunt-1.name: Miner Protection
NEW-Easy-KOR-Hunt-1.short_description: Striders hunt in packs. Try to single them out and don't let them overwhelm you
NEW-Easy-KOR-Hunt-1.description: Prospector, packs of Striders have been attacking our mining convoys! Go cull their numbers a bit.

NEW-Easy-KOR-Hunt-2.name: Prove your skills
NEW-Easy-KOR-Hunt-2.short_description: Try not to alert too many creatures at once, they can quickly overwhelm you
NEW-Easy-KOR-Hunt-2.description: Time for you to show what you're capable of! Kill creatures using a pistol to prove your skills.

NEW-Medium-KOR-Hunt-1.name: Rattle the Cage
NEW-Medium-KOR-Hunt-1.short_description: Rattlers can spit a beam of powerful projectiles. Make sure to use cover!
NEW-Medium-KOR-Hunt-1.description: Those damned Rattlers keep interfering with mining operations! Hunt some of them down, and use a Shotgun, make it brutal.

NEW-Medium-KOR-Hunt-2.name: Clearing the Dig Site
NEW-Medium-KOR-Hunt-2.short_description: You can use your map to find the specified location
NEW-Medium-KOR-Hunt-2.description: The Dig Site, one of our most valuable excavations, has been overrun by creatures! You know what to do, now go!

NEW-Medium-KOR-Hunt-3.name: Eliminate the Threat
NEW-Medium-KOR-Hunt-3.short_description: Wait for the Marauder to expose its weak spot to attack it!
NEW-Medium-KOR-Hunt-3.description: One of our excavators was just ripped to shreds by ferocious creatures, the kind known as "Marauders". I don't care how you do it, but hunt them down!

NEW-Hard-KOR-Hunt-1.name: Crashed Ship
NEW-Hard-KOR-Hunt-1.short_description: Rattlers can spit a beam of powerful projectiles. Make sure to use cover!
NEW-Hard-KOR-Hunt-1.description: According to Intel, a ship with valuable Osiris tech crashed in the Jungle. Go clear the area of Rattlers so our troops can loot the wreck!

NEW-Easy-ICA-Hunt-1.name: Rookie Hunter
NEW-Easy-ICA-Hunt-1.short_description: Try not to alert too many creatures at once, they can quickly overwhelm you
NEW-Easy-ICA-Hunt-1.description: Ah! There you are, Prospector. Before we give you any real work, go hunt some creatures to prove your worth, then report back to me.

NEW-Easy-ICA-Hunt-2.name: AR Calibration
NEW-Easy-ICA-Hunt-2.short_description: Try not to alert too many creatures at once, they can quickly overwhelm you
NEW-Easy-ICA-Hunt-2.description: We're considering equipping our troops with rifles against the creatures of Fortuna III. Grab an Assault Rifle, go down there and kill creatures with it.

NEW-Easy-ICA-Hunt-3.name: Secure the LZ
NEW-Easy-ICA-Hunt-3.short_description: You can use your map to find the specified location
NEW-Easy-ICA-Hunt-3.description: Prospector. Creatures are hindering our Research Teams from landing at Base Camp. You know what to do.

NEW-Medium-ICA-Hunt-1.name: Pest Control
NEW-Medium-ICA-Hunt-1.short_description: Wait for the Marauder to expose its weak spot to attack it!
NEW-Medium-ICA-Hunt-1.description: We need you to eliminate Marauders and Rattlers, Prospector! They're a threat to our scouts and scavengers.

NEW-Medium-ICA-Hunt-2.name: Parasites
NEW-Medium-ICA-Hunt-2.short_description: You can use your map to find the specified location
NEW-Medium-ICA-Hunt-2.description: We need your help, Prospector. Our Warehouse at Nutrion Farms got overrun by creatures. Get there before they destroy our stocked rations.

NEW-Hard-ICA-Hunt-1.name: Target Practice
NEW-Hard-ICA-Hunt-1.short_description: Wait for the Marauder to expose its weak spot to attack it!
NEW-Hard-ICA-Hunt-1.description: We want you to test out killing Marauders from a distance, see how easy they are to track... and how fast they can close in.

NEW-Hard-ICA-Hunt-2.name: Debugging
NEW-Hard-ICA-Hunt-2.short_description: Rattlers can spit a beam of powerful projectiles. Make sure to use cover!
NEW-Hard-ICA-Hunt-2.description: Rattlers are messing with what's left of the old Bright Sands Comms Tower facility; make sure they don't turn the place into a new nest.

NEW-Easy-Osiris-Hunt-1.name: Behavioral Analysis
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Hunt-1.short_description: Try not to alert too many creatures at once, they can quickly overwhelm you
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Hunt-1.description: We are gathering behavioral combat data on how creatures react to certain threats. Use a Pistol to hunt the specified amount of creatures."

NEW-Easy-Osiris-Hunt-2.name: Behavioral Analysis II
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Hunt-2.short_description: Striders hunt in packs. Try to single them out and don't let them overwhelm you
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Hunt-2.description: The last batch of data you brought us was useful, Prospector. This time, hunt Striders using an SMG and report back ASAP.

NEW-Easy-Osiris-Hunt-3.name: For Science
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Hunt-3.short_description: You can use your map to find the specified location
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Hunt-3.description: Ah, Prospector. Our Science Campus has been overrun by creatures! Go kill them to protect our delicate research equipment.

NEW-Easy-Osiris-Hunt-4.name: Population Control I
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Hunt-4.short_description: Rattlers can spit a beam of powerful projectiles. Make sure to use cover!
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Hunt-4.description: We've been monitoring creature populations, and there's been a sharp increase in Rattler numbers. Go eliminate some to keep their population in check.

NEW-Medium-Osiris-Hunt-1.name: Behavioral Analysis III
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Hunt-1.short_description: Try not to alert too many creatures at once, they can quickly overwhelm you
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Hunt-1.description: Time for more behavioral combat data, Prospector. Get yourself a Sniper Rifle and test it out by hunting any creatures on Fortuna.

NEW-Medium-Osiris-Hunt-2.name: Protect our Investments
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Hunt-2.short_description: Wait for the Marauder to expose its weak spot to attack it!
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Hunt-2.description: Prospector. Rattlers and Marauders are a major threat to our fragile sensors on Fortuna III. Go take care of some of these creatures.

NEW-Medium-Osiris-Hunt-3.name: Secure the Perimeter
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Hunt-3.short_description: You can use your map to find the specified location
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Hunt-3.description: The Science Campus and the Vaccine Labs, two very valuable Osiris sites, are teeming with creatures! You know what to do, Prospector.

NEW-Medium-Osiris-Hunt-4.name: Behavioral Analysis IV
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Hunt-4.short_description: Wait for the Marauder to expose its weak spot to attack it!
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Hunt-4.description: Next up in our Research, we need to analyze how Marauders react to Submachine Guns in combat. Grab one and go get us the data.

NEW-Medium-Osiris-Hunt-5.name: Xeno-Archaeology I
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Hunt-5.short_description: You can use your map to find the specified location
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Hunt-5.description: You know that big Skeleton on Crescent Falls? We want to send an Archaeologist to take a look at it, but it's crawling with Striders. Eliminate them.

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-1.name: Muddied Waters
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-1.short_description: You can use your map to find the specified location
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-1.description: Creatures roaming the Lake around our Lab have been obstructing research retrieval efforts. Take them out.

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-2.name: Brains over brawn
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-2.short_description: Crushers are tough creatures. Gear up or bring friends!
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-2.description: Some of the lab techs here hold the belief Crushers are Fortuna III's apex predator. Prove them wrong.

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-3.name: Sanitation
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-3.short_description: You can use your map to find the specified location
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-3.description: I'm sending a team down to check soil samples around the Crashed Ship; I need you to clear the area of vermin before they arrive.

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-4.name: Behavioral Analysis V
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-4.short_description: Crushers are tough creatures. Gear up or bring friends!
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-4.description: Time for another test: find out how thick a live Crusher's hide really is using an Assault Rifle or Sniper Rifle.

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-5.name: Living Black Box
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-5.short_description: Wait for the Marauder to expose its weak spot to attack it!
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-5.description: Marauders have been lingering around the Bright Sands Crashed Ship site; get rid of them so I can send someone to find out why.

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-6.name: Xeno-Archaeology II
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-6.short_description: You can use your map to find the specified location
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-6.description: Prospector! The Archaeology Team we sent to Skeleton Observation was attacked by Marauders. These beasts have to die so we can continue our research!

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-7.name: Pinnacle of Evolution
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-7.short_description: You can use your map to find the specified location
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Hunt-7.description: The Pinnacle Labs have been overrun by creatures. There is highly sensitive and valuable research equipment in there, Prospector, so get to work.

NEW-Medium-KOR-PvP-1.name: Testing the Arsenal
NEW-Medium-KOR-PvP-1.description: Prospector! It's time to test Korolev Weaponry against human targets. Grab a Korolev Weapon and eliminate rival Prospectors.

NEW-Hard-KOR-PvP-1.name: Protect our Claim
NEW-Hard-KOR-PvP-1.description: Greedy Prospectors have been filling their own pockets with valuable minerals from our Dig Site. Go eliminate any Prospector there, send a message!

NEW-Hard-KOR-PvP-2.name: Leaving a Mark
NEW-Hard-KOR-PvP-2.description: Some are saying Korolev is afraid of conflict! Get that idea out of their heads! Take out rival Prospectors, let them know Korolev sent you!

NEW-Hard-KOR-PvP-3.name: Live Fire
NEW-Hard-KOR-PvP-3.description: Prospector, marketing department wants more test data to sell our superior weapons; go take out rival Prospectors with Korolev Weapons!

NEW-Hard-KOR-PvP-4.name: Sales Pitch
NEW-Hard-KOR-PvP-4.description: Habitat Civil Protection doesn't believe our guns are worth the price; take out some rival Prospectors with a Korolev Pistol and Shotgun to shut them up!

NEW-Hard-KOR-PvP-5.name: Burying the Lead
NEW-Hard-KOR-PvP-5.description: KBR Longshot sales need a boost back home; let's show them what a Korolev rifle can do to Marauders and Prospectors!

NEW-Medium-ICA-PvP-1.name: Proprietary Technology
NEW-Medium-ICA-PvP-1.description: Those insufferable Osiris idiots are messing with our Uplinks. It's time to send a message. Eliminate a rival Prospector using an ICA Weapon, let them know it was us.

NEW-Medium-ICA-PvP-2.name: Retaliation
NEW-Medium-ICA-PvP-2.description: One of our scavenging parties was taken out by Prospectors. That offense can't go unpunished: eliminate some Prospectors to send a message.

NEW-Medium-ICA-PvP-3.name: Tour Guide
NEW-Medium-ICA-PvP-3.description: Fortuna III's seen a spike in "fake" Prospectors, here just to take in the scenery. Go down there and set the tone: take some out with an Assault Rifle.

NEW-Hard-ICA-PvP-and-PvE-1.name: On Our Team
NEW-Hard-ICA-PvP-and-PvE-1.description: A big arms merchant is on station looking to buy; head down and take out Striders, Rattlers, and Prospectors with the Advocate to help secure us a sale.

NEW-Hard-ICA-PvP-1.name: Hallowed Ground
NEW-Hard-ICA-PvP-1.description: Prospectors have been vandalizing what's left of the Bright Sands Base Camp; go down there and teach them some manners.

NEW-Hard-ICA-PvP-2.name: Restoring the Balance
NEW-Hard-ICA-PvP-2.description: Some believe Osiris and Korolev weapons outclass ours. Use ICA weapons to "educate" rival Prospectors as to who really makes the best guns.

NEW-Hard-ICA-PvP-3.name: Forest Clearing
NEW-Hard-ICA-PvP-3.description: I need someone to head down to the Bright Sands Jungle and make sure other Prospectors and the local wildlife learn to stay out of it. No, you don't need to know why.

NEW-Medium-Osiris-PvP-1.name: Superior Firepower
NEW-Medium-Osiris-PvP-1.description: We need to prove to these ICA troglodytes that Osiris weaponry is more than lethal. Use it to eliminate another Prospector.

NEW-Hard-Osiris-PvP-1.name: Lab Rats
NEW-Hard-Osiris-PvP-1.description: An opportunity has presented itself that requires some "special" testing. Head to the Waterfall and Vaccine Labs and prepare some "volunteers" for us to pick up.

NEW-Hard-Osiris-PvP-2.name: Internal Combustion
NEW-Hard-Osiris-PvP-2.description: The IFA filed a report that the Basilisk is "an unnecessarily cruel weapon"; take out some Prospectors with one and prove its efficacy outweighs all drawbacks.

NEW-Easy-Osiris-Brightcaps-1.name: Botanist I
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Brightcaps-1.short_description: Brightcaps can often be found near Swamps and Jungles
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Brightcaps-1.description: Prospector! The Brightcap Mushrooms found in the Swamps of Fortuna reportedly have vast medicinal applications. Get us some samples.

NEW-Easy-Osiris-Brightcaps-2.name: Botanist II
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Brightcaps-2.short_description: Brightcaps can often be found near Swamps and Jungles
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Brightcaps-2.description: We even found applications for Brightcap Mushrooms in fuel production. We need more! You know what is expected of you, Prospector.

NEW-Medium-Osiris-Brightcaps-and-PvE-1.name: Clear the Swamp
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Brightcaps-and-PvE-1.description: Those Blast Ticks are a real nuisance. Go eliminate some, and while you're there, bring back some Brightcaps.

NEW-Medium-Osiris-Brightcaps-3.name: Botanist III
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Brightcaps-3.short_description: Glowy Brightcaps can only be harvested during an active Storm
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Brightcaps-3.description: Our studies on Brightcaps continue. I need you to find a new specimen type, you'll be able to tell them apart by their glow. Now hurry!

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Brightcaps-and-PvE-1.name: Bad Acid
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Brightcaps-and-PvE-1.short_description: Glowy Brightcaps can only be harvested during an active Storm
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Brightcaps-and-PvE-1.description: Of course it would be that Acid Ticks feed on Glowy Brightcaps. Prospector, get me more samples, and kill some of those pests for good measure!

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Brightcaps-1.name: Harvest Day
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Brightcaps-1.short_description: Glowy Brightcaps can only be harvested during an active Storm
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Brightcaps-1.description: A lab contamination has cost us dozens of samples! You need to get down there and get more Brightcaps, glowing ones too. Now!

NEW-Easy-Osiris-BlueRunnerEgg-1.name: Egg Delivery
NEW-Easy-Osiris-BlueRunnerEgg-1.short_description: Keep an eye out for strange Alien Footprints, they may lead you to an Egg
NEW-Easy-Osiris-BlueRunnerEgg-1.description: We have heard of rare Blue Runner Eggs being found around Fortuna. Needless to say, we require a Sample for Analysis.

NEW-Easy-Osiris-BlueRunnerEgg-2.name: Egg Delivery II
NEW-Easy-Osiris-BlueRunnerEgg-2.short_description: Keep an eye out for strange Alien Footprints, they may lead you to an Egg
NEW-Easy-Osiris-BlueRunnerEgg-2.description: Prospector! The Blue Runner Egg you brought us proved full of invaluable genetic material. Bring us more of these Eggs!

NEW-Medium-Osiris-BlueRunnerEgg-1.name: Egg Delivery III
NEW-Medium-Osiris-BlueRunnerEgg-1.short_description: Keep an eye out for strange Alien Footprints, they may lead you to an Egg
NEW-Medium-Osiris-BlueRunnerEgg-1.description: We are close to being able to grow Blue Runners in our lab, Prospector, we just require more Blue Runner Eggs. You know what to do.

NEW-Medium-Osiris-Meteor-1.name: Unstable Sample
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Meteor-1.short_description: Meteor showers are a random event. Make sure to get there first to mine them!
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Meteor-1.description: Turns out these Meteor Shards that Korolev has been using to fuel their damn drills are fragments of Fortuna's Moon. We obviously need samples!

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Meteor-1.name: Core Values
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Meteor-1.short_description: Meteor showers are a random event. Make sure to get there first to mine them!
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Meteor-1.description: Ah, there you are, Prospector. We need you to drop down there and get us the Meteor Core of a Meteor Shower for some experiments. Off you go.

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Meteor-2.name: Promising Results
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Meteor-2.short_description: Meteor showers are a random event. Make sure to get there first to mine them!
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Meteor-2.description: Prospector, both Meteor Shards and Meteor Cores proved invaluable in our Xenological Research. Bring us more of both, and be discrete about it.

NEW-Medium-KOR-Meteor-1.name: Meteor Shards
NEW-Medium-KOR-Meteor-1.short_description: Meteor showers are a random event. Make sure to get there first to mine them!
NEW-Medium-KOR-Meteor-1.description: We have received reports of incredibly powerful Meteor Shards unpredictably dropping onto Fortuna in spectacular Meteor Showers. Go get us some!

NEW-Hard-KOR-Meteor-1.name: Meteor Core
NEW-Hard-KOR-Meteor-1.short_description: Meteor showers are a random event. Make sure to get there first to mine them!
NEW-Hard-KOR-Meteor-1.description: Prospector! Osiris seems to have gotten their hands on a Meteor Core from the main Meteor of a Meteor Shower. We need one as well!

NEW-Hard-KOR-Meteor-2.name: Shards of pure Power
NEW-Hard-KOR-Meteor-2.short_description: Meteor showers are a random event. Make sure to get there first to mine them!
NEW-Hard-KOR-Meteor-2.description: These Meteor Shards are incredibly valuable. We can use them to power our mining machinery. Bring us more, Prospector.

NEW-Hard-KOR-Meteor-3.name: Battery Day
NEW-Hard-KOR-Meteor-3.short_description: Meteor showers are a random event. Make sure to get there first to mine them!
NEW-Hard-KOR-Meteor-3.description: Prospector, we have developed a new type of Battery based on Meteor Cores that will fuel a drop ship or excavator for years. You know what to do!

NEW-Easy-ICA-Uplink-1.name: Data Drive
NEW-Easy-ICA-Uplink-1.short_description: Purchase a Data Drive at the ICA and slot it into an Uplink to upgrade its rarity
NEW-Easy-ICA-Uplink-1.description: Ah, Prospector. We have a task for you. Bring a Data Drive to the Planet and load it with Uncommon Data at one of our Uplinks.

NEW-Medium-ICA-Uplink-1.name: Data Drive II
NEW-Medium-ICA-Uplink-1.short_description: Purchase a Data Drive at the ICA and slot it into an Uplink to upgrade its rarity
NEW-Medium-ICA-Uplink-1.description: The Data you brought us was helpful, but we need more precise Meteorological Values. Load a Data Drive with Rare Data and deliver it to us.

NEW-Medium-ICA-Uplink-2.name: Data Drive III
NEW-Medium-ICA-Uplink-2.short_description: Purchase a Data Drive at the ICA and slot it into an Uplink to upgrade its rarity
NEW-Medium-ICA-Uplink-2.description: Good work last time, Prospector. The Data was perfect. This time, bring us two Rare Data Drives.

NEW-Hard-ICA-Uplink-1.name: Data Drive IV
NEW-Hard-ICA-Uplink-1.short_description: Purchase a Data Drive at the ICA and slot it into an Uplink to upgrade its rarity
NEW-Hard-ICA-Uplink-1.description: In order to be able to predict Storm Behaviour more precisely, we will need higher quality Data. Bring us a Tier 4 Data Drive.

NEW-Hard-ICA-Uplink-2.name: Data Drive V
NEW-Hard-ICA-Uplink-2.short_description: Purchase a Data Drive at the ICA and slot it into an Uplink to upgrade its rarity
NEW-Hard-ICA-Uplink-2.description: Yes! The more precise Data you brought us was a great success! Do you think you are ready to bring us a Tier 5 Data Drive?

NEW-Hard-ICA-Uplink-3.name: Data Drive VI
NEW-Hard-ICA-Uplink-3.short_description: Purchase a Data Drive at the ICA and slot it into an Uplink to upgrade its rarity
NEW-Hard-ICA-Uplink-3.description: We're finding more than just Storm data now... Get us more Tier 5 Data Drives, Prospector, what we might find could have immeasurable value!

NEW-Easy-ICA-Powerup-1.name: Energy Crisis
NEW-Easy-ICA-Powerup-1.description: The ICA draws a majority of its power from Miniature Reactors scavenged in old Power Facilities. Bring us one, Prospector.

NEW-Medium-ICA-Powerup-1.name: Energy Crisis II
NEW-Medium-ICA-Powerup-1.description: We need more power for our Community Life Support Systems, Prospector! Go get us more Miniature Reactors.

NEW-Medium-ICA-Powerup-2.name: Energy Crisis III
NEW-Medium-ICA-Powerup-2.description: Our Security Systems ran out of power and are runnning on emergency backup. This is not sustainable. We need more Miniature Reactors.

NEW-Hard-ICA-Powerup-1.name: A Solution?
NEW-Hard-ICA-Powerup-1.description: Prospector. We have gotten our hands on a load of powerful Energy Rifles Korolev has been working on. We need Miniature Reactors to charge them.

NEW-Easy-KOR-Stash-1.name: Excavation Gear
NEW-Easy-KOR-Stash-1.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop underground at East Collection Point on Bright Sands
NEW-Easy-KOR-Stash-1.description: For excavations, we need you to stash a Heavy Mining Tool in one of Badums Dead Drop Containers underground at East Collection Point. You'll find it.

NEW-Easy-KOR-Stash-2.name: Field Repairs
NEW-Easy-KOR-Stash-2.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop by the Blue Tarp under the Giant Skeleton in the Swamp on Bright Sands
NEW-Easy-KOR-Stash-2.description: Ah, there you are. Search for the Dead Drop Container at the Swamp Skeleton and stash some Ball Bearings in there. Our miners need them for field repairs.

NEW-Medium-KOR-Stash-1.name: Jamming the Comms
NEW-Medium-KOR-Stash-1.short_description: Stash Derelict Explosives in the Satellite Dish Dead Drop at Comms Tower on Bright Sands
NEW-Medium-KOR-Stash-1.description: Prospector. Acquire some Derelict Explosives and go stash them in the specified Dead Drop at Comms Tower. Be discrete about it, and no questions.

NEW-Medium-KOR-Stash-2.name: Tools for the Job
NEW-Medium-KOR-Stash-2.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop at Base Camp on Bright Sands
NEW-Medium-KOR-Stash-2.description: Prospector. Go deposit a Hammer Pistol in a Dead Drop at Base Camp for one of our Agents on Fortuna. They will take care of the rest.

NEW-Medium-KOR-Stash-3.name: Stability is Key
NEW-Medium-KOR-Stash-3.short_description: Search for the Dead Drops at Base Camp on Bright Sands
NEW-Medium-KOR-Stash-3.description: Our Comms are jammed. We need you to stash a Magnetic Field Stabilizer at each of the three Base Camp Dead Drops, Main Office, Gate A and Gate C.

NEW-Medium-KOR-Stash-4.name: And two smoking Barrels
NEW-Medium-KOR-Stash-4.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop at Comms Tower on Bright Sands
NEW-Medium-KOR-Stash-4.description: Prospector. Get down there and stash a PKR Maelstrom Shotgun and some Ammo at the Comms Tower for one of our Field Agents. And be discrete about it.

NEW-Hard-KOR-Stash-1.name: Stashing Safety
NEW-Hard-KOR-Stash-1.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop at Base Camp on Bright Sands
NEW-Hard-KOR-Stash-1.description: One of our Miners has been injured and is hiding near Base Camp. Go stash a Rare Shield for them there and clear the area of creatures.

NEW-Hard-KOR-Stash-2.name: Upgrades
NEW-Hard-KOR-Stash-2.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop at Starport Admin on Crescent Falls
NEW-Hard-KOR-Stash-2.description: We want to take over an ICA Data Center. Stash a Master Unit CPU at the Server Room so that our Tech Staff can use it to splice the System.

NEW-Easy-ICA-Stash-1.name: Grenadier
NEW-Easy-ICA-Stash-1.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop by the Blue Tarp under the Giant Skeleton in the Swamp on Bright Sands
NEW-Easy-ICA-Stash-1.description: Prospector. You have heard of Badum's Dead Drop Containers, right? We need you to find the one at Swamp Skeleton and stash Light Grenades in it for our Troops.

NEW-Medium-ICA-Stash-1.name: Storm Interference
NEW-Medium-ICA-Stash-1.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop at the Comms Tower on Bright Sands
NEW-Medium-ICA-Stash-1.description: Prospector, the Storm has been distorting all signals from our Comms Tower. We need you to head down there and stash Magnetic Field Stabilizers there.

NEW-Medium-ICA-Stash-2.name: Shady Deal
NEW-Medium-ICA-Stash-2.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop at Nutrion Farms on Crescent Falls
NEW-Medium-ICA-Stash-2.description: We'll have to do business with a rather shady arms dealer to supply our troops. They want us to stash Old Currency near Nutrion Farms as payment. Go.

NEW-Medium-ICA-Stash-3.name: Ambush
NEW-Medium-ICA-Stash-3.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop at Base Camp on Bright Sands
NEW-Medium-ICA-Stash-3.description: We are preparing an ambush on a spy that stole essential plans from us. For this, go stash a Shattergun in the Main Office Dead Drop at Base Camp.

NEW-Medium-ICA-Stash-4.name: Emergency Power
NEW-Medium-ICA-Stash-4.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop at Nutrion Farms on Crescent Falls
NEW-Medium-ICA-Stash-4.description: Prospector. Got a mission for you. Go stash a Miniature Reactor in the Storage Room Dead Drop at Nutrion Farms, as emergency power supply.

NEW-Medium-ICA-Stash-5.name: Ammo Supplies
NEW-Medium-ICA-Stash-5.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop at Greens Prospect on Crescent Falls
NEW-Medium-ICA-Stash-5.description: Our Field Agents need more Ammo if they are to protect our Research Installations. Go stash Medium Ammo at Stockpile near Greens Prospect for them.

NEW-Hard-ICA-Stash-1.name: Data Drop
NEW-Hard-ICA-Stash-1.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop at Greens Prospect on Crescent Falls
NEW-Hard-ICA-Stash-1.description: Prospector. One of our Scientists is convinced she can predict the Storm, but she needs Data. Stash Tier 3 Data Drives at Fulfilment Center for her.

NEW-Hard-ICA-Stash-2.name: Field Supplies
NEW-Hard-ICA-Stash-2.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop at Greens Prospect on Crescent Falls
NEW-Hard-ICA-Stash-2.description: We need to make more construction materials available to building sites on Crescent Falls. Go stash Polymetallic Prefabricate near Greens Prospect.

NEW-Hard-ICA-Stash-3.name: Spare Parts
NEW-Hard-ICA-Stash-3.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop at Starport Admin on Crescent Falls
NEW-Hard-ICA-Stash-3.description: One of the Servers at Starport has been failing. Before we can send down a Technician, stash new Zero Systems CPUs for them in the Server Room.

NEW-Hard-ICA-Stash-4.name: Provide an Advocate
NEW-Hard-ICA-Stash-4.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop at Starport Admin on Crescent Falls
NEW-Hard-ICA-Stash-4.description: Our field agent requested better gear to take down some creatures hindering his mission. Stash an Advocate Rifle at the Starport Cafeteria for him.

NEW-Easy-Osiris-Stash-1.name: Botanical Samples
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Stash-1.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop by the Blue Tarp under the Giant Skeleton in the Swamp on Bright Sands
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Stash-1.description: Prospector! We need you to get your hands on some Brightcaps and stash them in one of Badums hidden Dead Drop Containers at Swamp Skeleton.

NEW-Medium-Osiris-Stash-1.name: Lense Repairs
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Stash-1.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop at Comms Tower on Bright Sands
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Stash-1.description: It's time to replace the lenses of the Satellite Dish at Comms Tower. Look for the Dead Drop there and stash Optic Glass in it.

NEW-Medium-Osiris-Stash-2.name: Technical Supplies
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Stash-2.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop at Base Camp on Bright Sands
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Stash-2.description: The field technician in charge of our on-planet biosurveillance systems requires new Interactive Screens. Go stash some at Main Office.

NEW-Medium-Osiris-Stash-3.name: Self-Defence
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Stash-3.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop at Nutrion Farms on Crescent Falls
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Stash-3.description: Prospector. We need you to stash Asp Flechette Guns in the Storage Room on Crescent Falls for our security personnel. Go."

NEW-Medium-Osiris-Stash-4.name: Toxin Testing
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Stash-4.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop at Waterfall Lab on Bright Sands
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Stash-4.description: This mission requires maximum discretion, Prospector. Stash Toxic Glands at the Waterfall Lab for an experiment that is none of your business.

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Stash-1.name: Stormy Samples
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Stash-1.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop at Greens Prospect on Crescent Falls
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Stash-1.description: Ah, there you are. We need someone to go stash Charged Spinal Bases at the Fulfilment Center for our Field Scientists to pick up. Can you do it?

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Stash-2.name: Stormy Samples II
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Stash-2.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop at Pinnacle Labs on Crescent Falls
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Stash-2.description: Head down to Pinnacle Labs, look for the Dead Drop there and stash Glowy Brightcap Mushrooms in it. Our Field Scientists will pick them up later.

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Stash-3.name: Loadout Drop
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Stash-3.short_description: Search for the Dead Drop at Pinnacle Labs on Crescent Falls
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Stash-3.description: One of our more... lethal assets on Fortuna requires some gear for her next job. Go stash some in the Pinnacle Labs Dead Drop for her.

NEW-Easy-ICA-Flora-1.name: Calorie Deficit
NEW-Easy-ICA-Flora-1.description: Prospector, we are running low on food and need your help. Go get us some Waterweed Filaments for our Nutrient Farms. And hurry please.
NEW-Easy-ICA-Flora-1.short_description: Waterweed grows around Lakes and other still waters on Fortuna

NEW-Medium-ICA-Flora-1.name: Mouths to feed
NEW-Medium-ICA-Flora-1.description: We have to ask you once more to deliver some Waterweed Filaments to us. And more this time, to make sure we can feed the community a bit longer.
NEW-Medium-ICA-Flora-1.short_description: Waterweed grows around Lakes and other still waters on Fortuna

NEW-Medium-ICA-Flora-and-PvP-1.name: Gluttony
NEW-Medium-ICA-Flora-and-PvP-1.description: What?! Osiris has been harvesting OUR Waterweed for their Research? Go get us more Waterweed Filaments and eliminate a Prospector, as a warning!
NEW-Medium-ICA-Flora-and-PvP-1.short_description: Waterweed grows around Lakes and other still waters on Fortuna

NEW-Easy-Osiris-Flora-and-PvE-1.name: Pesticide
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Flora-and-PvE-1.description: Turns out that Striders sometimes feed on Waterweed Filaments. Eliminate some Striders for Ecosystem Analysis and bring us a few of those Filaments.
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Flora-and-PvE-1.short_description: Waterweed grows around Lakes and other still waters on Fortuna

NEW-Easy-Osiris-Flora-1.name: Pale Ivy
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Flora-1.description: We have received reports of strange Ivy-like plants growing on walls and cliffs, bearing rare beautiful blossoms. Needless to say, we need samples.
NEW-Easy-Osiris-Flora-1.short_description: Pale Ivy likes to grow on walls and cliffs in overgrown areas

NEW-Medium-Osiris-Flora-1.name: Cross-Breeding
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Flora-1.description: We want to cross-breed Pale Ivy with Waterweed, to hopefully create a plant with vast medicinal applications. Go get us the needed Mother Plants.
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Flora-1.short_description: Pale Ivy likes to grow on walls and cliffs in overgrown areas

NEW-Medium-Osiris-Flora-2.name: Dustbloom
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Flora-2.description: A scout came back rambling about gorgeous vibrant flowers growing in dry and open plains on Fortuna. Go see if you can find some, and bring them back.
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Flora-2.short_description: Dustbloom flourishes in open, arid areas of Fortuna

NEW-Hard-KOR-Gather-6.name: Stocking Up
NEW-Hard-KOR-Gather-6.description: We need Brittle Titan Ore, Prospector. And lots of it! I trust you know where to look for it by now? As they say, this is not your first rodeo.

NEW-Hard-KOR-Gather-7.name: Shock and Awe
NEW-Hard-KOR-Gather-7.description: Prospector, get us some Shock Absorbers from the surface, our equipment here needs maintenance. Get us the parts, if they're Korolev they'll still work for sure! Well... probably.

NEW-Medium-KOR-Gather-6.name: No Expiry Date
NEW-Medium-KOR-Gather-6.description: There you are, finally! There's been an accident at one of our factories and we urgently require Old Medicine from the surface, hurry!

NEW-Medium-ICA-Gather-5.name: Let it grow
NEW-Medium-ICA-Gather-5.description: Aha, there's our new rising star! Prospector, see if you can find us some Magic-GROW Fertilizer, it'll help with our nutrient farms on the station.

NEW-Hard-ICA-Gather-7.name: A Craving
NEW-Hard-ICA-Gather-7.description: Wanna make some extra cash? We would pay well for some Nutritional Bars. They taste funny, but nostalgia has deep pockets.

NEW-Hard-ICA-Gather-8.name: Prim & Proper
NEW-Hard-ICA-Gather-8.description: A delegation from off system just arrived, and our people need to look their best to woo them for patronage. Get us some Jewellery from the surface, hopefully we can impress.

NEW-Medium-Osiris-Gather-4.name: Flexible Sealant
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Gather-4.description: A number of our weather balloons took damage from recent storms, and we urgently need them back in the sky. Some Resin Guns should help patch them up.

NEW-Medium-Osiris-Gather-5.name: Indigenous Fruit
NEW-Medium-Osiris-Gather-5.description: Ah, Prospector, have you come across any Indigenous Fruit on the surface? They seem to be a remarkably high source of potassium, they could make for good, cheap supplements.

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Gather-8.name: Don't get crushed
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Gather-8.description: Gear up, Prospector! We need Crusher Skins for our Material Sciences Department. The tissue is said to be resistant to radiation, we must test that theory.

NEW-Hard-KOR-LaserDrill-1.name: Exclusive Drilling Rights
NEW-Hard-KOR-LaserDrill-1.short_description: Craft a Laser Drill Beacon, find a Letium Gas Vent and call down a Laser Drill Platform to Drill for Letium. But get ready to defend it.
NEW-Hard-KOR-LaserDrill-1.description: Alright Prospector; gear up and go get us some more Letium. We will of course pay extra for the risks, as well as you absolute secrecy...

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Flora-1.name: Fascinating Flora
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Flora-1.description: These Spine Briars are highly interesting. They seem to thrive on TEF radiation. I think we should try to grow some in our Lab, so get us some more specimens!
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Flora-1.short_description: Search the Caves of Tharis Island for Spine Briars

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Gather-9.name: In Charge
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Gather-9.description: Tssk. These Korolev Simpletons have been mining Tharis Iron without even understanding its true potential. Get us Charged Tharis Iron Ingots, and make sure to keep it confidential.
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Gather-9.short_description: Progress further on your Osiris Campaign to figure out how to get your hands on Charged Tharis Iron Ingots

NEW-Hard-KOR-Gather-8.name: Wastage Replacement
NEW-Hard-KOR-Gather-8.description: Prospector. We are still having some difficulties really making Tharis Iron work with our Manufacturing Processes. Get us some more of it as a basis for further Experiments.
NEW-Hard-KOR-Gather-8.short_description: Tharis Iron can only be mined in the Caves of Tharis Island

NEW-Hard-ICA-PvP-and-PvE-2.name: Negating the Area
NEW-Hard-ICA-PvP-and-PvE-2.description: Ah, finally. Our best Enforcer. We need you to drop down to Tharis Island and clear the area. We want to send our Scouts further in than ever before, so make sure it's safe.
NEW-Hard-ICA-PvP-and-PvE-2.short_description: Progress further on your Campaigns to unlock access to Tharis Island

Abilities_Cloak.name: Cloaking Device
Abilities_Cloak.description: Makes the operator nearly invisible for a short period, as long as the operator doesn't fire their weapon.
Abilities_Cloak.lore: Cloaking technology like this never became popular due to the large variety of scanning methods available to military elements, but they've retained their popularity among criminal elements and those running small covert jobs.

Abilities_Cloak_Ambush.name: Evasion Cloak
Abilities_Cloak_Ambush.description: A cloaking device that provide user with a small speed boost while cloaked.
Abilities_Cloak_Ambush.lore:
Originally intended to be an ambusher cloak, with the field around the user providing a noticeable speed boost to anything emitted from within it to improve offensive potential, the in that configuration the cloak was found to rapidly irradiate into the surroundings with whatever object was inside it. According to internal documents, no tests on human operators were ever performed, though Korolev was never known for keeping accurate or truthful records.

Fortunately for the company, a simple inversion (and massive powering down) of the field was found to provide operators with a useful boost to their movement speed, though at the cost of increasing that of anything impacting the field. The field manual however has this covered, sternly advising the user with "Don't get shot".

Abilities_Cloak_Still.name: Concealment Cloak
Abilities_Cloak_Still.description: A cloaking device that significantly improves effectiveness when static, at the cost of lower effectiveness when moving.
Abilities_Cloak_Still.lore:
Osiris opted to reinvent the wheel on this one, believing existing cloaking technology was simply lacking in its purported goal of actually cloaking the user. Plus it seemed cheaper and easier than paying the lawyers to figure out who still owned the rights to existing cloaking tech and dealing with whatever clods had come up with the original design.

This new cloak was capable of completely hiding its operator from view and conventional optic sensors, though it had the slight drawback of completely immobilizing the user while active (technically, operators could move, though it would cause excruciating pain and the cloak is unable to mute screams). With some fine-tuning the device was made to be slightly less effective while the operator attempted to remain perfectly still, and still allow full movement while active, though even a light gait will cause the cloak to shimmer brightly.

Abilities_KineticShield.name: Kinetic Barrier
Abilities_KineticShield.description: An energy barrier to protect from incoming attacks.
Abilities_KineticShield.lore:
Based on the same technology used to defend starships and stations from munitions and space debris for hundreds of years, the Kinetic Shield can project a small barrier able to take significant punishment before collapsing.

Thanks to some clever tech the AI controller on a prospector's suit is able to tell the barrier which projectiles and energy emissions to let through and which not, allowing the barrier's owner to fire through it while shielding them from oncoming fire.

Abilities_KineticShield_Shell.name: Protective Shell
Abilities_KineticShield_Shell.description: Deploys a kinetic shell that provides a short lived shield around the user, preventing them from taking or dealing damage for several seconds.
Abilities_KineticShield_Shell.lore:
The Protective Shell can be a real lifesaver, able to give a surprised prospector a chance to react to an ambush or stop an incoming missile from, well, doing what missiles do. And while it makes its user practically invulnerable without affecting their own weapons, the Shell's energy consumption is far too great to stay active for long.

Still, the tech has improved significantly since the first prototypes... between operators trapped in a rolling energy-egg rolling around the testing ground and discovering the need for strict user height limitations, the device is now almost completely safe to use!

Abilities_KineticShield_Dome.name: Safeguard
Abilities_KineticShield_Dome.description: A kinetic dome that covers a larger area with a strong shield that blocks both enemy and friendly fire.
Abilities_KineticShield_Dome.lore:
The Safeguard was developed for use in warzones where mission critical buildings and equipment were meant to be kept protected at all times from enemy fire, without impeding their actual use. While it can cover a larger area and take on more damage than the standard barrier, it doesn't discriminate friend or foe, allowing both to pass through the barrier freely, while also blocking all weapons' fire.

Some prospectors tinkered with prototypes that blocked movement entirely, the concept was quickly dropped; while this was found to be a useful way of keeping bad things out, it also had the unforeseen side effect of trapping its user inside, possibly with something they don't want to be near; a popular video typically shown to bright-eyed station arrivals shows the effects of a prospector missing the timing when attempting to block an incoming Warden Alpha. Good way to sober them up, and to remind people to not mod their abilities.

Abilities_Bombardment.name: Orbital Bombardment
Abilities_Bombardment.description: Marks an area to be targeted by remotely launched explosives.
Abilities_Bombardment.lore:
With countless satelites orbiting Fortuna III, it's only natural that some would carry weaponry. Some of these can be commanded by Prospectors, assuming they've paid the relevant ownership fees.

While a prospector's suit is able to detect incoming fire (or rather the targeting signal marking the desired impact coordinates) and take evasive action, fire from the sky always comes as a surprise to the hostile creatures of Fortuna III.

Abilities_Bombardment_Precision.name: Precision Strike
Abilities_Bombardment_Precision.description: An orbital bombardment that delivers high damage onto a small area.
Abilities_Bombardment_Precision.lore:
With countless satellites orbiting Fortuna III, it's only natural that some would carry weaponry. Some of these can be commanded by Prospectors, assuming they've paid the relevant ownership fees.

A smaller and denser projectile, this'll leave a lasting impression on whatever's unlucky enough to get hit by it.

Abilities_Bombardment_Cluster.name: Orbital Barrage
Abilities_Bombardment_Cluster.description: An orbital bombardment that delivers a barrage of small impacts over a large area.
Abilities_Bombardment_Cluster.lore:
With countless satellites orbiting Fortuna III, it's only natural that some would carry weaponry. Some of these can be commanded by Prospectors, assuming they've paid the relevant ownership fees.

"What if, instead of one big cannon, we installed a bunch of heavy machineguns on our satellites?"

'What if' indeed.

Abilities_BlinkDagger.name: Directional Warp
Abilities_BlinkDagger.description: Fires a warp point through which the operator will be transported, or on demand while warp point is in transit.
Abilities_BlinkDagger.lore:
While teleporting technology in itself isn't new, it's traditionally required a fixed device at the destination point to safely transmit matter without reconstruction errors; this new Warp device operates by using an unstable phase construct as its end point.

Pay no heed to reports of the technology only just being approved for testing on single-cell organisms in Federation controlled space.

Abilities_BlinkDagger_Damage.name: Warp Bomb
Abilities_BlinkDagger_Damage.description: A directional warp device that emits a damaging explosion at the warp exit point.
Abilities_BlinkDagger_Damage.lore:
While teleporting technology in itself isn't new, it's traditionally required a fixed device at the destination point to safely transmit matter without reconstruction errors; this new Warp device operates by using an unstable phase construct as its end point.

The unstable part is key here. Turns out with some small tweaks you can syphon the energy mean to stabilize the warp transfer into a small energy blast just as the transfer initiates. Unfortunately the warp projectile's speed had to be reduced to compensate, though this was only discovered after testing.

Junior Researcher Ricardo Galvin is still on sabbatical and Korolev has no time for spurious speculation on his whereabouts.

Abilities_HealingWard.name: Shield Generator
Abilities_HealingWard.description: A device that emits a static energy field to assist Prospector's kit's healing rate.
Abilities_HealingWard.lore: Little more than a canister full of medical nanites and a weak energy field to keep them powered, it can still bring a Prospector back from the brink of death. Most of these devices are synced with their owner. You know, to not waste energy and all that.

Abilities_HealingWard_Harm.name: Skirmish Sphere
Abilities_HealingWard_Harm.description: A sphere that covers a larger area and harms hostiles.
Abilities_HealingWard_Harm.lore:
The usually docile nanites of the medical triage sphere are suspiciously agitated in this particular device, giving the energy field a menacing hue.

While most of these devices are synced with their owner to heal them, this one actively instructs the nanite cloud to harm other entities. "Harm" in this context means "hundreds of thousands of miniscule floating robot crabs slicing through living matter cell by cell".

Fun.

Abilities_HealingWard_Attached.name: Healing Aura
Abilities_HealingWard_Attached.description: A triage sphere attached to the operator, but less healing power.
Abilities_HealingWard_Attached.lore:
Little more than a canister full of medical nanites and a weak energy field to keep them powered, it can still bring a Prospector back from the brink of death.

Regular Healing Wards have are too delicate to be moved around, as the nanites inside would float away out of their energy containment field. This one keeps a stronger field, ensuring all those little robots are trapped in their energy prison for the remainder of their very short lives. Also the field is smaller, requires more energy to concentrate the barrier limit or something.

Abilities_TurretHeavy.name: Heavy Turret
Abilities_TurretHeavy.description: Calls down a heavy automated turret that will engage any hostiles in view.
Abilities_TurretHeavy.lore: Nothing says "Korolev" like a vehicle mounted cannon bolted onto an all-terrain platform capable of being dropped from orbit into the middle of a battlefield.

Abilities_SnareMine.name: Snare Trap
Abilities_SnareMine.description: A small device that will tether hostiles to its anchored location for a short duration, this does not include prospectors..
Abilities_SnareMine.lore: While the ICA developed traps like these to be used against Squatters, they're more often than not used by Prospectors to entangle their competitors in chokepoints or near items of interest, leaving them vulnerable to ambush.

Abilities_OTecStim.name: Shield charger
Abilities_OTecStim.description: A device that replenishes part of the missing shield.
Abilities_OTecStim.lore:
Oh yeah, just inject yourself with about two million tiny little robots, what ever could possibly go wrong?

(historically, a lot, but we finally got the tech right, honest!)

Abilities_OTecStim_02.name: Health Boost
Abilities_OTecStim_02.description: A stim that gives an immediate health boost, initiates health regeneration and temporarily increase damage resistance.
Abilities_OTecStim_02.lore:
Oh yeah, just inject yourself with about two million tiny little robots, what ever could possibly go wrong?

(historically, a lot, but we finally got the tech right, honest!)

Abilities_OTecStim_Adrenaline.name: Adrenaline Shot
Abilities_OTecStim_Adrenaline.description: A stim that increases movement speed.

Abilities_OTecStim_StandGround.name: Stand Your Ground
Abilities_OTecStim_StandGround.description: A stim that temporarily halves damage received, at the cost of reducing the movement speed.
Abilities_OTecStim_StandGround.lore: Similar to the regular health stim, this one charges the nanites into overdrive so they harden specific user's soft tissues and flood traumatized areas with healing serums. Hardening tissues does mean an overall reduction in movement due to stiffness, but that's a price a surprising number of people seem willing to pay.

Abilities_OTecGrenade.name: Shock Grenade
Abilities_OTecGrenade.description: Light grenade explodes after a few seconds or on contact with hostiles.

Abilities_BounceGrenade.name: Trench Grenade
Abilities_BounceGrenade.description: Heavy grenade that explodes after several seconds.
Abilities_BounceGrenade.lore:
It's a grenade.

You throw it, it explodes.

Abilities_OTecGrenade_02.name: Shock Grenade
Abilities_OTecGrenade_02.description: Light grenade explodes after a few seconds or on contact with hostiles.
Abilities_OTecGrenade_02.lore:
It's a grenade.

You throw it, it explodes.

Abilities_SurveillanceWard.name: Surveillance Ward
Abilities_SurveillanceWard.description: A deployable scanner that reveals prospectors and objectives on the map.
Abilities_SurveillanceWard.lore:
A disposable, orbital-dropped scanner, Osiris uses these to find the best mineral deposits on the surface, but isn't adverse to launching them for Prospectors with high enough standing.

If you hear a sort of beeping sound coming from the scanner, that's actually its scan pulses reverberating inside your skull and impacting some dense matter. You might want to get that checked out.

Abilities_SnareMine_Event_01.name: Holiday Snare Trap
Abilities_SnareMine_Event_01.description:
Every prospector loves running into surprise presents from strangers!

A small device that will tether its lucky finder to its anchored location for a short duration while administring joyful electric charges.
Abilities_SnareMine_Event_01.lore: NOTE: This item will only be available during the holidays!

Abilities_OTecGrenade_02_Event_01.name: Holiday Grenade
Abilities_OTecGrenade_02_Event_01.description:
A generous gift to hand around.

Light grenade explodes after a few seconds or on contact with anyone that isn't your friend yet.
Abilities_OTecGrenade_02_Event_01.lore: NOTE: This item will only be available during the holidays!

Abilities_TurretHeavy_Event_01.name: Holiday Turret
Abilities_TurretHeavy_Event_01.description:
Let this little helper deliver for you.

Orders down a heavy automated turret that will engage any grumps in view for its 90 second lifetime. Will attack any Prospector not enjoying the holidays with its owner. Only one can be active at a time.
Abilities_TurretHeavy_Event_01.lore: NOTE: This item will only be available during the holidays!

Abilities_TurretHeavy_Ouroboros.name: Energy Turret
Abilities_TurretHeavy_Ouroboros.description: Calls down a heavy automated turret that will engage any non-human hostiles in view.
Abilities_TurretHeavy_Ouroboros.lore: Built from a schematic found on Fortuna III, this turret carries a mix of pre and post-Cycle technology to fire concentrated balls of plasma, similar to how Spitters and other beasts use the Cycle's unique energy for lethal purposes. Its overall performance is comparable to the standard Korolev Heavy Turret, but it will not attack human enemies.
